timeline.subject: Jennon Ramaixe
timeline.details: Accused confronted with Didie veuve Demenge Pourlat just before execution. At first did not recognize her, then changed mind and persisted with accusation

timeline.subject: Jennon Ramaixe
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal of county of Blamont asks for preliminary investigation

timeline.subject: Jennon Ramaixe
timeline.details: Informations preparatoires conducted. Held in 'prisons ferme'

timeline.subject: Jennon Ramaixe
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses. Generally fruitless, disagreed on all substantial points

timeline.subject: Jennon Ramaixe
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to torture 'mediocrement'

timeline.subject: Jennon Ramaixe
timeline.details: Interrogation under torture. Withstood lengthy torture without making serious admissions

timeline.subject: Jennon Ramaixe
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal asks for threat of question extraordinaire, or if she denies, banishment for life and goods confiscated

timeline.subject: Jennon Ramaixe
timeline.details: Change de Nancy agrees to reinterrogation under threat of torture, but if no confession, should be renvoyée jusqu'au rappel

timeline.subject: Jennon Ramaixe
timeline.details: Lengthy interrogation with new evidence about curing Catherine widow of Demenge Courier. Held out stoutly against hostile questioning

timeline.subject: Jennon Ramaixe
timeline.details: Procureur fiscal points to new evidence and variations, asks for question extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Jennon Ramaixe
timeline.details: Change de Nancy declares new evidence not sufficient for fresh torture. Ordered released

torture.requesting_official: Procureur fiscal of county of Blamont

accomplices_named.name: la Gerardaire (la Gerardine)
accomplices_named.context: Named Jennon as companion from Blamont at her execution 5 years earlier

prior_accusations.context: Accused Jennon at execution as her companion; led to first arrest and interrogation 5 years earlier
Accused Jennon of seeing her at sabbat just before Didie's execution on 18 June 1599

notable_quotes.speaker: Jennon Ramaixe
notable_quotes.french: que sy ce n'estoit pour les enffans elle ne se soucyeroit de mourir mais qu'elle craindoit la honte d'iceulx
notable_quotes.english: if it were not for the children she would not mind dying but she feared the shame to them
notable_quotes.context: Repeated statement to neighbors about her reputation and potential execution

notable_quotes.speaker: Jennon Ramaixe
notable_quotes.french: elle ne luy en scavoit point de mauvais gré qu'elle les entendoit bien elle mesme dequoy elle ne s'en donnoit pas beaucoup de peine n'estoit la honte de ses enfans
notable_quotes.english: she did not bear them ill will, that she understood them well herself, and it gave her little trouble except for the shame to her children
notable_quotes.context: Response when told other women feared her at the oven

notable_quotes.speaker: Jennon Ramaixe
notable_quotes.french: la malheure suis je icy venu l'on dira que j'ay faict mourir ledit poulain car je suis desja en reputation d'estre sorciere
notable_quotes.english: unhappy am I to have come here, they will say I killed the foal because I am already reputed to be a witch
notable_quotes.context: When foal dropped dead after she fetched it from eating barley

notable_quotes.speaker: Wife of Colas Caillotte of Auricourt (cunning woman)
notable_quotes.french: et que plus de bien elle luy feroit plus de mal luy advinndroit
notable_quotes.english: and the more good she did to her the more harm would come to her
notable_quotes.context: Warning about Jennon to Chrestienne after consultation about illness and dead horse

notable_quotes.speaker: Jennon wife of Mengeon the herdsman
notable_quotes.context: Accused Jennon publicly of being a witch and of having killed her first husband during a quarrel

notable_quotes.speaker: Jehenne Saulnier
notable_quotes.context: At veillée, when Jennon was looking for something on floor, suggested perhaps she was looking for her master (devil)

notable_quotes.speaker: Jennon Ramaixe
notable_quotes.french: on faisoit bien tort aux personnes
notable_quotes.context: Response to Jennon Jacquot's implicit threat about her second husband

relationships.evidence_text: Had married Didier Ramaixe and lived with him 'en bonne paix et concorde' for 37 years; he had been dead for 2 years
Having 10 children; two youngest in Allemaigne aged 12 and 14
Had lived in suburb of le Viel Marché close to Jennon for 13 years
Neighbour for 6 years
Neighbour for 15 or 16 years
la Gerardaire previously their neighbour
her husband kept 'four banal' of Viel Marché
Had been neighbour for 4 years some 18 years before
She had been chambermaid to whom Jennon had said second twin would die
5 years earlier her sister-in-law had been ill

relationships.person1: Catherine fille de feu Jean Henry Michiel
relationships.evidence_text: Catherine fille de feu Jean Henry Michiel de Blamont, femme Jean Henrequel

relationships.person1: Catherine fille de feu Jean Henry Michiel
relationships.evidence_text: fille de feu Jean Henry Michiel
veuve Jean Henry Michiel
Husband and wife giving consistent testimony
Husband repeated wife's story
Jennon was neighbour, always in his house
For last 18 months Jennon as neighbour had frequented their house
his mother-in-law Mesline
Husband and wife both testified
Jennon's husband had undertaken carpentry for Jean Hannel's house
Told story in accord with wife's deposition
Nicolas repeated deposition of brother

relationships.person2: Margueritte wife of Nicolas de Sercoeur
relationships.evidence_text: neighbour Margueritte persuaded Jennon to help Catherine

economic_context.details: Jennon's husband withdrew from carpentry contract with Jean Hannel because he was losing money and Hannel would not compensate him - this led to suspicion when Hannel's horse died. Jennon reportedly had very little - only 'demi-quarteron' of wheat. Jean Claude brought wheat from Germany and one day there was none for Jennon, which may have angered her. Jennon's husband kept oven (four banal) previously. After first accusation, women feared her at the oven and she had to be asked to keep away, affecting her economic activities.

harms_catalog.harm_description: death 15 days after Jennon predicted it would not live long
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Jennon told chambermaid child would die

harms_catalog.victim_name: horse of Chrestienne and Bernard Faltin

harms_catalog.victim_name: foal of Chrestienne and Bernard Faltin
harms_catalog.harm_description: foal dropped dead when Jennon went to fetch it from eating barley
lost milk for baby, breasts very swollen
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: refused to beat orphan girl who disputed with Jennon's son
harms_catalog.method_alleged: witchcraft, then cured by Jennon's remedy (butter rubbed on breasts before fire)

harms_catalog.victim_name: two cows of Demenge le Comte
harms_catalog.harm_description: death of two cows (all animals he had), one found drowned in very shallow stream
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: vengeance because he deposed against her at first imprisonment

harms_catalog.harm_description: bad hand preventing work all harvest, healer said intention was to make him lose arm
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: saw Jennon wet from fields early morning, told others at oven about her reputation

harms_catalog.victim_name: 6 horses of Jean Claude le jeune
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: one day there was no wheat for Jennon when he brought it from Germany
resentment that wife testified on first arrest

harms_catalog.victim_name: two more horses of Didier Saulnier

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: stopped employing her husband for carpentry after disagreement
refused to sell Jennon milk, then Jennon admired child and lifted blanket

harms_catalog.victim_name: three horses of Margueritte and Didier Saulnier
harms_catalog.harm_description: deaths of three horses, husband constantly met Jennon taking them out in mornings

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: refused milk to Jennon, then implicit threat about second husband
testified against Jennon at previous imprisonment

extraction_metadata.notes: This is a remarkably detailed trial record showing a rare release outcome. Jennon Ramaixe withstood torture and was ultimately released by the Change de Nancy despite extensive witness testimony. The trial shows the cascading effects of a prior accusation by la Gerardaire 5 years earlier, which created lasting reputation damage. Key features: (1) Previous arrest and release 5 years earlier after accusation by executed witch; (2) Extensive testimony about reputation but mixed evidence - some witnesses saw no harm in her, others blamed her for animal deaths and child deaths; (3) Jennon's repeated concern about shame to her children; (4) Economic marginalization after first accusation (excluded from oven, feared by women); (5) Pattern of quarrels over small economic matters (milk, wheat, employment) followed by harms; (6) Jennon provided folk remedies that worked (butter for milk, water cure for Catherine); (7) Withstood torture without confession; (8) Change de Nancy twice refused prosecutor's requests for further torture and ordered release. Significant for understanding factors in survival: torture resistance, lack of confession, previous release creating precedent, insufficient new evidence, mixed witness testimony.
